articles.title: BBVA and OpenAI collaborate to transform global banking
articles.summary: BBVA has partnered with OpenAI to revolutionize global banking by leveraging artificial intelligence and machine learning. This collaboration aims to enhance customer experiences, improve operational efficiency, and develop innovative financial products. By integrating OpenAI's technology, BBVA seeks to become a leader in AI-driven banking and set a new standard for the industry.

articles.title: BNY builds “AI for everyone, everywhere” with OpenAI
articles.summary: BNY Mellon has partnered with OpenAI to develop an "AI for everyone, everywhere" initiative, aiming to make artificial intelligence more accessible and widely adopted. This collaboration will enable the bank to leverage OpenAI's technology to drive innovation and improve customer experiences. The partnership is expected to have a significant impact on the financial industry, promoting AI adoption and democratization.

articles.title: How We Used Codex to Ship Sora for Android in 28 Days
articles.summary: The team behind Sora successfully launched their Android app in just 28 days using Codex, a cutting-edge AI-powered coding tool. Codex enabled rapid development by automating code generation, allowing the team to focus on high-level design and functionality. This achievement demonstrates the potential of AI-assisted coding to significantly accelerate app development timelines.

articles.title: Advancing science and math with GPT-5.2
articles.summary: Researchers have unveiled GPT-5.2, a cutting-edge AI model that promises to revolutionize science and math education by providing personalized learning experiences and assisting with complex problem-solving. This innovation has the potential to make STEM subjects more accessible and engaging for students of all levels. By leveraging GPT-5.2, educators can create tailored lesson plans and interactive tools to enhance student understanding and achievement.

articles.title: Introducing GPT-5.2
articles.summary: OpenAI has unveiled GPT-5.2, a significant update to its language model, offering improved performance, efficiency, and capabilities. This new model is expected to enhance various applications, including chatbots, language translation, and content generation. With GPT-5.2, users can anticipate more accurate and human-like interactions with AI systems.

articles.title: Improved Gemini audio models for powerful voice experiences
articles.summary: Google has upgraded its Gemini audio models, enabling more accurate and efficient voice recognition for a wide range of applications. This improvement enhances voice experiences, allowing for better speech-to-text capabilities and more natural voice interactions. The updated models open up new possibilities for developers to create innovative voice-powered features and services.

articles.title: Deepening our partnership with the UK AI Security Institute
articles.summary: A leading tech company is strengthening its partnership with the UK AI Security Institute to advance AI-powered security solutions. This collaboration aims to enhance threat detection and response capabilities, driving innovation in the field of cybersecurity. The partnership is expected to have a significant impact on the development of more effective and secure AI systems.

articles.title: Strengthening our partnership with the UK government to support prosperity and security in the AI era
articles.summary: A major tech company has announced a strengthened partnership with the UK government to harness AI for economic growth and national security. This collaboration aims to drive innovation, create jobs, and enhance the UK's position as a global leader in AI. The partnership will focus on developing and implementing AI solutions to support key sectors, including healthcare, education, and cybersecurity.

articles.title: FACTS Benchmark Suite: Systematically evaluating the factuality of large language models
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced the FACTS Benchmark Suite, a comprehensive tool for evaluating the factuality of large language models, enabling a systematic assessment of their ability to provide accurate and reliable information. This suite aims to address the growing concern of misinformation generated by AI models, promoting more trustworthy and transparent language processing systems. By using FACTS, developers can identify and improve the factual accuracy of their models, ultimately enhancing the overall performance and reliability of AI-powered applications.

articles.title: Engineering more resilient crops for a warming climate
articles.summary: Scientists are developing more resilient crops to combat the challenges of a warming climate, using innovative engineering techniques to enhance their ability to withstand extreme temperatures and weather conditions. This breakthrough has the potential to improve global food security and reduce crop losses due to climate-related stress. By engineering crops to be more climate-resilient, researchers aim to ensure a stable food supply for future generations.

articles.title: New in llama.cpp: Model Management
articles.summary: The latest update to llama.cpp introduces model management, allowing users to easily switch between different AI models and manage their configurations. This innovation streamlines the development process and enables more efficient experimentation with various models. By simplifying model management, llama.cpp enhances its usability and flexibility for developers working with AI applications.

articles.title: Codex is Open Sourcing AI models
articles.summary: Codex is taking a significant step by open-sourcing its AI models, allowing developers to access and build upon its cutting-edge technology. This move is expected to accelerate innovation and collaboration in the field of artificial intelligence, driving new applications and use cases. By making its models openly available, Codex is democratizing access to AI and empowering a broader community of developers to create new solutions.

articles.title: Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker: Cost-efficient Frontier Multimodal Performance
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker, a cutting-edge multimodal model that achieves state-of-the-art performance while being more cost-efficient. This innovation enables faster and more affordable processing of large amounts of data across various formats, such as text, images, and videos. By reducing computational costs, Apriel-1.6-15b-Thinker has the potential to make AI more accessible to a wider range of applications and industries.

articles.title: Introducing swift-huggingface: The Complete Swift Client for Hugging Face
articles.summary: The swift-huggingface library has been introduced, providing a complete Swift client for Hugging Face, a popular platform for natural language processing (NLP) models. This library enables Swift developers to easily integrate Hugging Face models into their apps, allowing for advanced NLP capabilities such as text classification and language translation. With swift-huggingface, developers can now leverage the power of Hugging Face models in their Swift-based projects.

articles.title: DeepMath: A lightweight math reasoning Agent with smolagents
articles.summary: Researchers have introduced DeepMath, a cutting-edge math reasoning agent that leverages smolagents to provide lightweight and efficient mathematical problem-solving capabilities. This innovative approach enables DeepMath to tackle complex math problems with improved accuracy and speed. By combining AI and math reasoning, DeepMath has the potential to revolutionize education and research in mathematics.

articles.title: macOS 26.2 enables fast AI clusters with RDMA over Thunderbolt
articles.summary: macOS 26.2 introduces a significant update, enabling fast AI clusters with RDMA (Remote Direct Memory Access) over Thunderbolt, allowing for high-speed data transfer and accelerated AI processing. This innovation enables developers to create powerful AI clusters using multiple Macs connected via Thunderbolt, boosting performance and efficiency. By leveraging RDMA over Thunderbolt, macOS 26.2 unlocks new possibilities for AI development and research.

articles.title: OpenAI are quietly adopting skills, now available in ChatGPT and Codex CLI
articles.summary: OpenAI has introduced a new feature called "skills" in ChatGPT and Codex CLI, allowing users to access specialized tools and capabilities within the platforms. This update enables more precise and efficient interactions, enhancing the overall user experience. With skills, OpenAI's models can now perform a wider range of tasks, from code completion to content generation, with greater accuracy and speed.

articles.title: Google removes Sci-Hub domains from U.S. search results due to dated court order
articles.summary: Google has removed Sci-Hub domains from its US search results, complying with a court order from 2017 that aimed to curb access to the platform, which provides free access to scientific and academic papers. This move may limit researchers' ability to access certain papers, potentially hindering scientific progress. The removal highlights the ongoing tension between copyright holders and advocates for open access to knowledge.
